cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest then turning north-northwest, skirting the Florida east coast and then paralling the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible brush/landfall along the Florida east-central coast (near Cape Canaveral – Jacksonville corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River on the Florida Gulf Coast (includes Tampa Bay region)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Suwannee River (Tropical Storm Warning) and Boca Raton FL to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Warning on Atlantic side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast and portions of Georgia–South Carolina coasts; limited impact possible along Florida Gulf Coast from Englewood northward including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Chance (up to 35%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; strongest gusts most likely Friday as Matthew parallels the Atlantic side of the state.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible in Tampa Bay and adjacent Gulf waters if strong onshore flow develops.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could produce 2–4 inches locally, lower than Atlantic side totals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions throughout the eastern Gulf of Mexico shipping lanes.
